author: @abhijitkundu1879

text: The Bajaj Chetak 3502 has a running cost of around Rs. 0.15 per kilometer. Charging the scooter, assuming a daily run of 50 kilometers and a per-unit electricity cost of Rs. 6.5, will cost approximately Rs. 225 per month. This is based on the Chetak 3502 having a 3.5 kWh battery and consuming about 3.5 units of electricity for a full charge.

author: @kumbidimon

text:
I have Purchased Chetak from Patni automobile Nagpur, But Got Mental Stress in Return
I would never have imagined that buying an electric vehicle from a reputed company like Bajaj Chetak, and more specifically from Patni Motors, could turn out to be such a painful and mentally exhausting experience. But sadly, that has been my reality from the very start ‚Äî right from false promises during purchase to a completely broken after-sales experience.

1. Visit to Patni Service Centre ‚Äì No Inspection, No Support
Recently, due to issues with my rear tyre (which has a dug), severe vibration, and dropping battery range, I had no choice but to personally go to the Patni Chetak service centre to seek help. I met Mr. Rupesh Heda, expecting assistance.

He simply told me:

"Job card banwa lo."

I did exactly that ‚Äî filled out the job card and followed the instructions, assuming my vehicle would be checked. But shockingly, no technician even inspected my vehicle. When I asked why my vehicle wasn't being looked at, the technician said:

"Main electrical wiring ka kaam kar raha hoon pehle se."

So basically, they had no bandwidth or backup system, and just dumped the customer aside. How can a customer be satisfied with this kind of response? No timeline, no guidance, and no priority, even for a new vehicle owner. It made me feel that the service center exists only to make excuses, not to solve problems.

2. Loop Holes in the Service System ‚Äì No Process, No Professionalism
There seem to be no systems or accountability inside their service center.

You yourself have to find the manager, get the job card made, then wait indefinitely with no technician ready to inspect your vehicle.

There's no communication, and nobody cares to update or guide the customers who are already suffering due to product issues.

3. Humiliating Gate Experience ‚Äì Customers Treated Like Outsiders
To top it all off, the security guard at the entrance didn‚Äôt even allow my vehicle inside the service center premises saying:

‚ÄúGadi andhar nahi laa sakte!‚Äù

Is this how a paying customer who is already facing product issues is treated? Should a customer run from counter to counter, from security to technician ‚Äî without any urgency or empathy?

4. This Is Not a Vehicle ‚Äì It‚Äôs a Source of Mental Stress
I bought Chetak hoping for a good electric riding experience. Instead, I feel like I‚Äôve bought myself tons of mental frustration, wasted time, and zero satisfaction. What‚Äôs the point of giving "RSA" and "Warranty" when nobody even comes forward to take responsibility for the vehicle‚Äôs condition?

5. Final Word: Don‚Äôt Buy from Patni Chetak
If any future customer is planning to purchase a Chetak vehicle, especially from Patni Motors, I sincerely request:

Talk to the service technicians and observe before buying.

Check online reviews like this one before booking your vehicle.

Do not fall for sweet sales talk at the time of booking ‚Äî they vanish when you ask for help.

They claim they care about quality and after-sales, but in reality ‚Äî they are just making fools out of customers. I regret trusting Patni Motors and Bajaj Chetak. I expected care and professionalism but received neglect, arrogance, and mental harassment in return.

So paise bachane kae chakkar ulta nuksan ho rha hy please apna paise aaisi jagha barbad na kare jaha apko respect na mile.
author: @The-creative-crew

text: OLA is the best EV scooter in the India EV market. I am having awesome riding experience with my OLA S1x 4KW for the last 9+ months. Guys do not look at negative comments of OLA. Issues might be there with Gen1 OLA. Gen2 and Gen3 OLA scooters are much much better. Small issues will be there with every product. Focus on whether the company is trying to overcome all those issues or not. I see OLA is advancing in terms technology, reliability, performance and mileage and finally the price. OLA is the best.
